image.altText: Matt Wright pic (1)

props.synopsis: Bugged phone calls, allegations of lies and planned destruction of evidence — revelations from the first week of the criminal trial against Outback Wrangler Matt Wright.

title.children: Outback Wrangler's bugged midnight phone call at centre of charge

image.altText: Willow Brennan wearing a yellow shirt and wide brimmed hat scratches the side of a white cow.

props.synopsis: High school students are learning about animal care and possible careers as the region grapples with a shortage of vets.

title.children: Top End town fights vet shortage by training teenagers in animal care

image.altText: Four boys handcuffed and lying topless on the ground at night as two guards stand over them.

props.synopsis: Four former Don Dale detainees unlawfully tear gassed inside the Northern Territory's notorious youth prison will challenge cuts to their compensation in Australia's High Court.

title.children: Former Don Dale detainees to take compensation fight to High Court

image.altText: A man stands in front of a large house with his arms held open.

props.synopsis: Despite a surge in interest rates and a jump in loss-making rentals, few landlords are selling up. Experts say it's because negative gearing and the capital gains tax discount protect their investments.

title.children: Mega landlords 'can't lose' as revenue collapse brings negative gearing boon

image.altText: Two researchers rehearsing their TED talks on a stage.

props.synopsis: According to the Aussie experts gearing up for their first TED talk this weekend, storytelling is key — but breaking down a subject you understand so deeply, to share that knowledge with the world, comes with a whole lot of nerves.

title.children: How do you prepare a TED talk? Everyday experts share their process

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenskyy, wearing a plain black jumper, speaks into a mic in front of an ornate background, next to a Ukrainian flag.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump had said a prospective peace deal between Russia and Ukraine would likely include "some swapping of territories", ahead of a meeting between himself and the Russian president in Alaska next Friday.

title.children: Zelenskyy rejects ceding of territory to Putin, risking clash with Trump

image.altText: A photo of a pencil drawing of Nimrod Cohen. He is young, has dark hair, a short beard and moustache.

props.synopsis: Nimrod Cohen was taken hostage on October 7, 2023, when Hamas launched its deadly attacks on Israel. His family fears he will become collateral if the international community does not put more pressure on Israel to end the war in Gaza.

title.children: Father of Israeli hostage calls for Palestinian recognition

image.altText: A woman walks through a destroyed street and protects her head from debris

props.synopsis: The foreign ministers of Australia, Germany, Italy, New Zealand and the United Kingdom say this decision will "risk violating international humanitarian law".

title.children: Australia strongly condemns Israel's plan to seize Gaza City

image.altText: A photo of Tsutomu Yamaguchi. He has short white hair, brown eyes, and is wearing a black collared shirt.

props.synopsis: There are not many people that have survived a nuclear attack. Tsutomu Yamaguchi is the only person that officially survived two.

title.children: 'It was my fate to keep on living': How one man survived two nuclear attacks

image.altText: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu speaks during a press conference in Jerusalem.

props.synopsis: The debate in the Israeli media over Benjamin Netanyahu's plans to occupy Gaza have barely mentioned the fate of the two million people who live there.

title.children: Israel's plan is unfolding at a time leaders don't care about global criticism

image.altText: James Tomkins drapped in the Australian flag, in front of the Olympic rings, looking over his right shoulder

props.synopsis: A Victorian study has found elite male rowers are seven times more likely to develop atrial fibrillation, a common heart rhythm disorder associated with increased risk of stroke.

title.children: Elite male rowers seven times more likely to develop heart disorder, study finds

image.altText: Inside the La Trobe Reading Room at the State Library Victoria.

props.synopsis: Are we really comfortable with trading away one of the few financial benefits Australian creatives have left?

title.children: We can't throw Australian creatives and their work into the maws of Big Tech

image.altText: Anthony Albanese holds a press conference with New Zealand prime minister Christopher Luxon.

props.synopsis: The two leaders are also expected to discuss their positions on the humanitarian crisis in Gaza and recognising Palestinian statehood.

title.children: Defence and trade top of the agenda for PM's meeting in New Zealand

image.altText: Tall pine trees in front of a snow-capped mountain range.

props.synopsis: National Parks are being forced to stay open despite operating on a "bare-bones" crew after cuts to staff and funding. Rangers say they can't sustain it.

title.children: Once 'America's best idea', National Parks are reaching their breaking point

image.altText: Graphic of Queensland premier David Crisafulli with business receipts.

props.synopsis: Politicians have private business, but that business is sometimes thrust into the public arena, raising questions about how transparent they're required to be, writes Liam Walsh.

title.children: How Qld's premier went from property flipper to secret business trouble

image.altText: close up of man wearing a space suit with his head revealed, he is smiling

props.synopsis: In a statement, his family hails him as their "hero" and say the man who led the infamous Apollo 13 space mission "was truly one of a kind".

title.children: Apollo 13 moon mission commander Jim Lovell dies at 97

image.altText: Electricians place solar panels on roof

props.synopsis: As Australia's energy transition hits turbulence, a quiet but fundamental shift is underway.

title.children: Can Australia's staggering 'small-scale flex' save our energy future?

image.altText: Matt Wright pic (1)

props.synopsis: Bugged phone calls, allegations of lies and planned destruction of evidence — revelations from the first week of the criminal trial against Outback Wrangler Matt Wright.

title.children: Outback Wrangler's bugged midnight phone call at centre of charge

image.altText: noni Hazlehurst, with fair long hair and fringe, sits near a front bar at a pub, smiling with closed mouth.

props.synopsis: After the huge success of her first one-woman show, Mother, Noni Hazlehurst sits down with ABC Arts to speak frankly about her new show and the powerful publican at the centre of it.

title.children: Noni Hazlehurst's latest show will make you leave your judgements at the door

image.altText: Erin Patterson police video

props.synopsis: A police interview given by Erin Patterson after she murdered her relatives with a meal laced by poisonous death cap mushrooms has been released by Victoria's Supreme Court.

title.children: Watch Erin Patterson's police interview about deadly mushroom lunch

image.altText: President Donald Trump speaks to US military officers

props.synopsis: The US president has directed the Pentagon to prepare options, however Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum said in response that members of the US military would not be entering Mexican territory.

title.children: Trump moves to target drug cartels with US military

image.altText: A young woman with long black hair holds a baby girl in her arms standing in a kitchen

props.synopsis: Women who have spent years navigating the health system seeking care for extreme pain say they are frustrated at the slow pace of a government inquiry into the issue.

title.children: 'It's not right': Frustration as Australian-first women's pain inquiry in limbo

image.altText: Kathleen Folbigg thanks her supporters in a video she released after being pardoned for wrongful conviction

props.synopsis: Experts are calling for more transparency in the way compensation is calculated for people who are wrongfully imprisoned, after a $2 million payment offered to Kathleen Folbigg was slammed as "totally inadequate".

title.children: 'Can you put a number on it?' The price of wrongful imprisonment

image.altText: Head and shoulders portrait of Gareth Ward

props.synopsis: Well before Gareth Ward's conviction for serious sex crimes, he was one of the most powerful politicians in NSW. His political career unravelled until he stood alone and, finally, in the dock.

title.children: Once a Liberal rising star, Gareth Ward is now behind bars

image.altText: people gather around a yellow bus that has overturned in kenya

props.synopsis: The driver lost control of the bus as it approached a roundabout at high speed and plunged into a ditch, according to a regional traffic officer.

title.children: Bus carrying mourners from a funeral overturns in Kenya, killing 25

image.altText: GettyImages-2224074188

props.synopsis: Matildas coach Joe Montemurro says October's friendly against Wales will be a crucial step in his squad's preparations for next year's Asian Cup.

title.children: Matildas relishing 'perfect test' ahead of Asian Cup campaign

image.altText: Former NSW Police officers Nathan Black wearing black hoodies and black mask, left, and Timothy John Trautsch, right, in a suit

props.synopsis: The actions of Timothy John Trautsch and Nathan Black were recorded on body-worn camera after they were called to Emu Plains following reports of a welfare check.

title.children: Ex-police officers jailed over 'gratuitous cruelty' to mentally ill woman

image.altText: A satellite view of a city block in Hobart showing a large building and car park.

props.synopsis: Community advocates want a massive CBD block turned into medium-density housing rather than "another car yard for Hobart", with UTAS putting the site on the market.

title.children: YIMBYS want this massive CBD block turned into dense housing

image.altText: Gaypalani Waṉambi, an Indigenous woman in her late 30s, poses in front of an art work made of discarded road signs.

props.synopsis: Gaypalani Waṉambi, daughter of the late Mr Waṉambi, has won the top prize at the National Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Art Awards, for work about an ancient honey hunter.

title.children: Art work made from discarded road signs wins $100,000 art prize

image.altText: A man wears a black hat and a black top, he looks solemnly at camera. Behind him is a sign reading 'Buy SA'

props.synopsis: Amid SA's algal bloom, fish and chip shop owners are keen to emphasise they are still very much open for business — and some want more done to provide reassurance.

title.children: Fish and chip shops battle to calm algae anxiety

image.altText: Cast of five performers standing on stage.

props.synopsis: A critically acclaimed Australian stage adaptation of George Orwell's novel 1984 attracts full houses as it tours across the nation.

title.children: Dystopian George Orwell classic 1984 finds new audience on stage

image.altText: Laura Kane, AFL Executive General Manager of Football and Emma Moore, GM of AFLW speak with media

props.synopsis: The AFL has locked in the AFLW grand final venues for each state and is not open to moving to a larger stadium, regardless of home and away crowd numbers or demand.

title.children: The AFL won't budge on AFLW venues as comp searches for certainty

image.altText: Chris Woakes leaves the field injured during England's fifth Test against India.

props.synopsis: England all-rounder Chris Woakes says rehabilitation is a risk he is willing to take to be fit for the men's Ashes, which kicks off in Perth in November.

title.children: Woakes may opt for rehab over surgery in race to be fit for Ashes

image.altText: A medium sized black white and yellow honeyeater sitting on a branch.

props.synopsis: Birdwatchers spot two critically endangered regent honeyeaters on the Mid North Coast of New South Wales, giving conservationists hope the species' numbers are higher than thought.

title.children: 'Exceptionally rare' bird sighting shocks and delights twitchers
